name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one has a melting point that we can compare to by analyzing its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is 1,3-oxazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methoxybenzylidene group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +30. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5. The oxazole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20.
